text: hi everyone I'm Lindsay and today on
sweet talk I'm making a crowd-pleasing
classic simple layer cake with vanilla
buttercream I'm starting by creaming my

mixer fitted with the paddle attachment
and one stick of unsalted butter that's
room temperature tonight I'm adding one
and a half cups of granulated sugar I'm
gonna let this go on medium high for a
minute or two until it's light and
fluffy so while this is beating I'll get
going on my dry ingredients here I have
2 cups of all-purpose flour to that I'm
adding a tablespoon of baking powder and
a half teaspoon of fine salt fine salt
is saltier than kosher salts so if
you're using kosher salt at home you'll
want to use more maybe like a teaspoon
instead of half a teaspoon so next give
this a quick whisk make sure the baking
powder is all combined with the flour so
you don't get patches of bubbles in your
cake
this looks light and fluffy I'm gonna
give it a quick scrape with my spatula
and next I'm adding my eggs and as you
guys know baking is a science so here
it's really important that your eggs are
room-temperature if all of your dairy
your eggs your milk if that's all room
temperature you'll have no trouble
mixing your cake powder so I'm adding
three eggs one at a time
[Applause]
and one teaspoon of vanilla
as you can see because our eggs were

so now I'm ready to go into the oven

really easily so now let this go on

it is nice and fluffy

now I'm adding my confectioners sugar so
